step1.ptxt: CHECK DTC (When not using intelligent tester)

step2.ptxt: Using SST, connect terminals 13 (TC) and 4 (CG) of the DLC3.
Read the DTC from the ABS warning light on the combination meter.

item.ptxt: If no code appears, check the TC and CG terminal circuit or ABS warning light circuit.
If more than 1 DTC is detected at the same time, the DTCs will be displayed in numerical order.
As an example, the blinking patterns for a normal system code and DTCs 11 and 21 are shown in the illustration.
DTCs are explained in the Diagnostic Trouble Code Chart.

step2.ptxt: After completing the check, disconnect terminals 13 (TC) and 4 (CG) of the DLC3, and turn off the display.
Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Read the DTCs by following the prompts on the tester screen.

atten4.ptxt: Refer to the intelligent tester operator's manual for further details.

step1.ptxt: CLEAR DTC (When not using intelligent tester)

step2.ptxt: Using SST, connect terminals 13 (TC) and 4 (CG) of the DLC3.
Clear the DTCs stored in the ECU by depressing the brake pedal 8 times or more within 5 seconds.
Check that the ABS warning light displays the normal system code.
Remove SST from the terminals of the DLC3.

atten4.ptxt: DTCs cannot be cleared by removing the battery cable or ECU-IG and GAUGE fuse.

step2.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Operate the intelligent tester to erase the codes.

atten4.ptxt: Refer to the intelligent tester operator's manual for further details.

step2.ptxt: Check that the ABS warning light illuminates and then turns off in approximately 3 seconds.
